com.tomtom.speedtools.mongodb

Class MongoDBUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.mongodb.MongoDBUtils

  • public final class MongoDBUtils
extends Object
    This class provides generic methods to operate on Mongo Collections.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MONGO_PATH_SEPARATOR
      The MONGO_PATH_SEPARATOR is the concatenation string used by Mongo to concatenate fields (the 'dot' notation).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static com.mongodb.BasicDBObject createBasicDBObjectFromRectangle(GeoRectangle nonWrappedRect, GeoPointMapper geoPointMapper)
      This method will return a BasicDBObject representing a Mongo box.
      static String mongoPath(EntityMapper.HasFieldName... parts)
      Create a mongo path based on HasFieldName parts.

    • Field Detail

      • MONGO_PATH_SEPARATOR

        public static final String MONGO_PATH_SEPARATOR
        The MONGO_PATH_SEPARATOR is the concatenation string used by Mongo to concatenate fields (the 'dot' notation).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • mongoPath

        @Nonnull
public static String mongoPath(@Nonnull
                                        EntityMapper.HasFieldName... parts)
        Create a mongo path based on HasFieldName parts.
        Parameters:
        parts - The parts that make up the Mongo path. Cannot be empty.
        Returns:
        A string representing the Mongo path.

      • createBasicDBObjectFromRectangle

        public static com.mongodb.BasicDBObject createBasicDBObjectFromRectangle(@Nonnull
                                                                         GeoRectangle nonWrappedRect,
                                                                         @Nonnull
                                                                         GeoPointMapper geoPointMapper)
                                                                  throws MapperException
        This method will return a BasicDBObject representing a Mongo box. In case the GeoRectangle is zero the area will be stretched slightly in order to create a valid object. Mongo does not allow zero sized boxes.
        Parameters:
        nonWrappedRect - The rectangle that is the target for the box object. This rectangle may NOT be wrapped. The caller must make sure this is the case. This can be done by invoking the GeoRectangle.pixelate() function first, which may return multiple, non-wrapped rectangles.
        geoPointMapper - The mapper that knows how to map Java objects to Mongo.
        Returns:
        A BasicDBObject representing a Mongo box.
        Throws:
        MapperException - If the area could not be mapped.
